GOD.content: relation of gift to “present,” essential knot in interlace of this discourse [GT], in knot of Geflecht of which Heidegger says the circle is perhaps only one figure/particular case
GOD.linkedContent: relation of gift to “present,” essential knot in interlace of this discourse [GT], in knot of Geflecht of which Heidegger says the circle is perhaps only one figure/particular case

GOD.content: gift as gift w/out essence, can’t be seen in light of day, must be the secret, secrecy is the last word of the gift which is the last word of the secret
GOD.linkedContent: gift as gift w/out essence, can’t be seen in light of day, must be the secret, secrecy is the last word of the gift which is the last word of the secret

GOD.content: trembling in mysterium tremendum? gift of infinite love, dissymmetry btwn gaze of God, and me not seeing what looks at me (gift and endurance of death in irreplaceable) > disproportion btwn infinite gift & my finitude > responsibility: salvation, sin, culpability, sacrifice
GOD.linkedContent: trembling in mysterium tremendum? gift of infinite love, dissymmetry btwn gaze of God, and me not seeing what looks at me (gift and endurance of death in irreplaceable) > disproportion btwn infinite gift & my finitude > responsibility: salvation, sin, culpability, sacrifice

GOD.content: via Baudelaire’s “The Pagan School,” any exchange w/ purpose, any remuneration, slightest hint of calculation transforms gift into counterfeit money
GOD.linkedContent: via Baudelaire’s “The Pagan School,” any exchange w/ purpose, any remuneration, slightest hint of calculation transforms gift into counterfeit money

GOD.content: one must give w/out knowing, w/out object; one must suppress the object of the gift, to keep in the gift only the giving
GOD.linkedContent: one must give w/out knowing, w/out object; one must suppress the object of the gift, to keep in the gift only the giving

GT.content: gift interrupts economy, is aneconomic, is the impossible
GT.linkedContent: gift interrupts economy, is aneconomic, is the impossible

GT.content: obsessing over circle encircling us, Heidegger [see OS] on circle, point, as vulgar time; time as circle: one of most powerful, ineluctable representations in history of metaphysics ——can’t exactly escape circle, it’s a feast for thinking, but gift as instant of effraction of circle
GT.linkedContent: obsessing over circle encircling us, Heidegger [see OS] on circle, point, as vulgar time; time as circle: one of most powerful, ineluctable representations in history of metaphysics ——can’t exactly escape circle, it’s a feast for thinking, but gift as instant of effraction of circle

GT.content: could only be a gift the instant the paradoxical instant tears time apart (what Kierkegaard means when he says decision is madness)
GT.linkedContent: could only be a gift the instant the paradoxical instant tears time apart (what Kierkegaard means when he says decision is madness)

GT.content: why desire to interrupt circulation of circle, why desire the gift?
GT.linkedContent: why desire to interrupt circulation of circle, why desire the gift?

GT.content: credit, good faith, we lend each other in conversation; credit/faith as precomprehension that condition “tautology” of gift, and make gift impossible: “one” has to give some “thing” to someone other
GT.linkedContent: credit, good faith, we lend each other in conversation; credit/faith as precomprehension that condition “tautology” of gift, and make gift impossible: “one” has to give some “thing” to someone other

GT.content: gift annulled each time there is restitution or countergift
GT.linkedContent: gift annulled each time there is restitution or countergift

GT.content: temporalization of time (memory, present, anticipation, pro, re-tention, imminence of future, “ecstases”) destroys the gift via keeping (la garde), restitution, comprehending in advance
GT.linkedContent: temporalization of time (memory, present, anticipation, pro, re-tention, imminence of future, “ecstases”) destroys the gift via keeping (la garde), restitution, comprehending in advance

GT.content: recognition of the gift annuls it
GT.linkedContent: recognition of the gift annuls it

GT.content: gift does not exist, represent itself
GT.linkedContent: gift does not exist, represent itself

GT.content: be careful, ethically vigilant re: gift w/out debt, there’s calculation & ruse (economy) even in the unconscious
GT.linkedContent: be careful, ethically vigilant re: gift w/out debt, there’s calculation & ruse (economy) even in the unconscious

GT.content: forgetting of gift must be far more radical than repression, which always consists of keeping by exchanging places, its operation is systematic or topological
GT.linkedContent: forgetting of gift must be far more radical than repression, which always consists of keeping by exchanging places, its operation is systematic or topological

GT.content: forgetting & gift condition each other (unconditional)
GT.linkedContent: forgetting & gift condition each other (unconditional)

GT.content: subject and object are arrested effects of the gift, arrests of the gift; subject as such never gives or receives a gift
GT.linkedContent: subject and object are arrested effects of the gift, arrests of the gift; subject as such never gives or receives a gift

GT.content: “there is gift,” not the same as “the gift exists”  [ontological difference?]
GT.linkedContent: “there is gift,” not the same as “the gift exists” [ontological difference?]

GT.content: even if gift is a simulacrum, il faut (one must) rendre compte (render an account) of the possibility of this simulacrum, and render account of desire to render account > can’t be done w/out principle of reason (principium reddendae rationis)
GT.linkedContent: even if gift is a simulacrum, il faut (one must) rendre compte (render an account) of the possibility of this simulacrum, and render account of desire to render account > can’t be done w/out principle of reason (principium reddendae rationis)

GT.content: which law obligates one to answer for, to account for, a gift that calls one beyond all responsibility?
GT.linkedContent: which law obligates one to answer for, to account for, a gift that calls one beyond all responsibility?

GT.content: the alogos, madness, of rendering account (logos) of the atopos (the gift), desire to think the impossible, to desire, to desire to give the impossible: madness as given & desired forgetting
GT.linkedContent: the alogos, madness, of rendering account (logos) of the atopos (the gift), desire to think the impossible, to desire, to desire to give the impossible: madness as given & desired forgetting

GT.content: perhaps, mode of gift, (atopic, utopic) madness of desire to give the impossible, this madness would also be a forgetting, to forget the gift [secret of death]
GT.linkedContent: perhaps, mode of gift, (atopic, utopic) madness of desire to give the impossible, this madness would also be a forgetting, to forget the gift [secret of death]

GT.content: how could one desire a gift that is non-ambivalent? a gift that would not be pharmakon, poison, that would be good? how does one desire forgetting
GT.linkedContent: how could one desire a gift that is non-ambivalent? a gift that would not be pharmakon, poison, that would be good? how does one desire forgetting

GT.content: demand of gift/countergift, circulatory differance, requirement of restitution “at term,” delayed “due date,” thing itself demands gift & restitution
GT.linkedContent: demand of gift/countergift, circulatory differance, requirement of restitution “at term,” delayed “due date,” thing itself demands gift & restitution

GT.content: demand for term & temporization, very structure of the thing, demand for limit, boundary, margin, a demand which dawns in gift-counter-gift
GT.linkedContent: demand for term & temporization, very structure of the thing, demand for limit, boundary, margin, a demand which dawns in gift-counter-gift

GT.content: logic of gift under the regime of to have, to be?give what one possess or what one doesn’t possess?
GT.linkedContent: logic of gift under the regime of to have, to be?give what one possess or what one doesn’t possess?

GT.content: the irremediable heterogeneity of the gift
GT.linkedContent: the irremediable heterogeneity of the gift

GT.content: poisoned gifts of intellectual legacies, poison that never fails to call forth a counter-poison presented in guise of counter-gift
GT.linkedContent: poisoned gifts of intellectual legacies, poison that never fails to call forth a counter-poison presented in guise of counter-gift

GT.content: language as a phenomenon of gift-countergift, of giving-taking, of exchange, all difficulties of nomination/writing are difficulties of self-naming, self writing (se nommer, s’écrire)
GT.linkedContent: language as a phenomenon of gift-countergift, of giving-taking, of exchange, all difficulties of nomination/writing are difficulties of self-naming, self writing (se nommer, s’écrire)

GT.content: donner reviendrait à prendre et prendre à donner; this would fold itself over on language/writing beyond logocentric closure
GT.linkedContent: donner reviendrait à prendre et prendre à donner; this would fold itself over on language/writing beyond logocentric closure

GT.content: question of the “come” of the “come back” will invaginate, efface, all borders, will redouble endlessly ambivalence of gift as good or bad, gift or poison (Gift-gift)
GT.linkedContent: question of the “come” of the “come back” will invaginate, efface, all borders, will redouble endlessly ambivalence of gift as good or bad, gift or poison (Gift-gift)

GT.content: what is a border (bord) or an approach (aborder) once the indivisibility of the trait is no longer secure (assurée)? gift will always be w/out border
GT.linkedContent: what is a border (bord) or an approach (aborder) once the indivisibility of the trait is no longer secure (assurée)? gift will always be w/out border

GT.content: gift overruns border & suspends its relation to border, is beyond transgression
GT.linkedContent: gift overruns border & suspends its relation to border, is beyond transgression

GT.content: no problematic of gift on basis of metaphysics of presence, or sign, signifier, signified, or value > only w/ problematic of trace of text
GT.linkedContent: no problematic of gift on basis of metaphysics of presence, or sign, signifier, signified, or value > only w/ problematic of trace of text

GT.content: subject as such: bordered, posed, identified, always calculates, reappropriates surplus-value, circular return, a certain capitalization
GT.linkedContent: subject as such: bordered, posed, identified, always calculates, reappropriates surplus-value, circular return, a certain capitalization

GT.content: despite labor of subject, production of surplus-value, gift takes place where there’s trace, dissemination, in excessive forgetting, forgetful excess of the gift
GT.linkedContent: despite labor of subject, production of surplus-value, gift takes place where there’s trace, dissemination, in excessive forgetting, forgetful excess of the gift

GT.content: death: the fact that the gift does not return to the donor; death not a natural accident, can only be thought setting out from (à partir du) the gift > neither death nor immortal life can give anything, only a singular surviving can give
GT.linkedContent: death: the fact that the gift does not return to the donor; death not a natural accident, can only be thought setting out from (à partir du) the gift > neither death nor immortal life can give anything, only a singular surviving can give

GT.content: no gift w/out advent of an event, no event w/out surprise of the gift
GT.linkedContent: no gift w/out advent of an event, no event w/out surprise of the gift

GT.content: narrative gives possibility of impossibility of story as story of gift or forgiveness
GT.linkedContent: narrative gives possibility of impossibility of story as story of gift or forgiveness

GT.content: condition common to gift & event: unconditionality > chance, tukhē, in an instant, disorder, surprise, irruptive, unmotivated, freedom of dice throw, coup de don, obey nothing but disorder, principles w/out principles, not necessary, gratuitous, déchirer la trame
GT.linkedContent: condition common to gift & event: unconditionality > chance, tukhē, in an instant, disorder, surprise, irruptive, unmotivated, freedom of dice throw, coup de don, obey nothing but disorder, principles w/out principles, not necessary, gratuitous, déchirer la trame

GT.content: event, gift, must be structured by aleatory, remain unforeseeable w/out being kept so
GT.linkedContent: event, gift, must be structured by aleatory, remain unforeseeable w/out being kept so

GT.content: gift is no longer effect even if there are gift effects (des effets de don)
GT.linkedContent: gift is no longer effect even if there are gift effects (des effets de don)

GT.content: one must intend to give a gift, and yet all intentionality threatens the gift w/ self-keeping > intentional freedom & chance must miraculously agree w/ each other
GT.linkedContent: one must intend to give a gift, and yet all intentionality threatens the gift w/ self-keeping > intentional freedom & chance must miraculously agree w/ each other

GT.content: in Baudelaire’s “Counterfeit Money”, “looking for noon at two o’clock,” exhausting faculty of gift
GT.linkedContent: in Baudelaire’s “Counterfeit Money”, “looking for noon at two o’clock,” exhausting faculty of gift

GT.content: nature as gift vs. nature as given (necessary)
GT.linkedContent: nature as gift vs. nature as given (necessary)

GT.content: beggars (in their exteriority) can represent absolute demand of the Other, inextinguishable appeal, unquenchable thirst for the gift
GT.linkedContent: beggars (in their exteriority) can represent absolute demand of the Other, inextinguishable appeal, unquenchable thirst for the gift

GT.content: violence of gift: takes by surprise in such a way as to trap, indebt the receiver, place, hold in a process of circulation, but this violence irreducible whether it repeats or interrupts the circle
GT.linkedContent: violence of gift: takes by surprise in such a way as to trap, indebt the receiver, place, hold in a process of circulation, but this violence irreducible whether it repeats or interrupts the circle

GT.content: or: a surprise surprising enough to be forgotten w/out delay, beyond Being, epekeina tes ousia: secret about which one cannot speak, but can no longer remain silent
GT.linkedContent: or: a surprise surprising enough to be forgotten w/out delay, beyond Being, epekeina tes ousia: secret about which one cannot speak, but can no longer remain silent

GT.content: link btwn morality & calculation of pleasure equivocates good intentions, precipitates gift towards its end, is its very apocalypse [Hamacher], truth of gift > end of gift
GT.linkedContent: link btwn morality & calculation of pleasure equivocates good intentions, precipitates gift towards its end, is its very apocalypse [Hamacher], truth of gift > end of gift

GT.content: gift is a stranger to morality, to will, perhaps to freedom,
GT.linkedContent: gift is a stranger to morality, to will, perhaps to freedom,

GT.content: conditions of gift/event: outside law, unforseeable, surprise, excess, beyond reason
GT.linkedContent: conditions of gift/event: outside law, unforseeable, surprise, excess, beyond reason

GT.content: only a hypothesis of counterfeit money (incalculable) could make gift possible
GT.linkedContent: only a hypothesis of counterfeit money (incalculable) could make gift possible

GT.content: chremastics vs. economy: 1) chremastics, ovular or seminal capital, “bad infinite” of money, no limit 2) economy, oikos, care for home, hearth, limited to necessary goods
GT.linkedContent: chremastics vs. economy: 1) chremastics, ovular or seminal capital, “bad infinite” of money, no limit 2) economy, oikos, care for home, hearth, limited to necessary goods

GT.content: limit gets blurred once there’s monetary sign, or simply sign, once there’s differance & credit, family no longer contained > this originary ruin is chance of hospitality—like counterfeit money, chance for gift itself [Aristotle looks for balanced limit, not Derrida]
GT.linkedContent: limit gets blurred once there’s monetary sign, or simply sign, once there’s differance & credit, family no longer contained > this originary ruin is chance of hospitality—like counterfeit money, chance for gift itself [Aristotle looks for balanced limit, not Derrida]

GT.content: gift must not be generous
GT.linkedContent: gift must not be generous

GT.content: truth of gift would be (un)veiled by veil of tears rather than sight
GT.linkedContent: truth of gift would be (un)veiled by veil of tears rather than sight

GT.content: a gift is not signed, does not calculate w/ a time that would do it justice
GT.linkedContent: a gift is not signed, does not calculate w/ a time that would do it justice

R.content: Derrida speaking from the bottom of his heart: the excessive gift goes straight to his heart, to what he holds dear, to what holds him to life > any words of welcome (hospitality) too modest
R.linkedContent: Derrida speaking from the bottom of his heart: the excessive gift goes straight to his heart, to what he holds dear, to what holds him to life > any words of welcome (hospitality) too modest

H.content: absolute hospitality offers gift w/out reservations

POO.content: “what returns to your name, to the secret of your name, is the ability to disappear in your name,” that is, not to return to itself, which is the condition of the gift (i.e. the name) of all expansion of self, of all auctoritas
POO.linkedContent: “what returns to your name, to the secret of your name, is the ability to disappear in your name,” that is, not to return to itself, which is the condition of the gift (i.e. the name) of all expansion of self, of all auctoritas

SPOM.content: a justice beyond the economy of repression, not distributive, not calculable equality, outside of the economy of vengeance, incalculability of the gift and singularity, infinite asymmetry, the an-economic ex-position to others
SPOM.linkedContent: a justice beyond the economy of repression, not distributive, not calculable equality, outside of the economy of vengeance, incalculability of the gift and singularity, infinite asymmetry, the an-economic ex-position to others

SPOM.content: Heidegger especially wants to wrest gift away from spirit of revenge, where people equate the just (das Gerechte) w/ the avenged (das Gerächte)
SPOM.linkedContent: Heidegger especially wants to wrest gift away from spirit of revenge, where people equate the just (das Gerechte) w/ the avenged (das Gerächte)

SPOM.content: wouldn’t thinking the gift as justice, as what one does not have (Plotinus), and comes back or belongs to the other, risk inscribing “whole movement” of justice in presence, coming into presence? [Heidegger’s gathering]
SPOM.linkedContent: wouldn’t thinking the gift as justice, as what one does not have (Plotinus), and comes back or belongs to the other, risk inscribing “whole movement” of justice in presence, coming into presence? [Heidegger’s gathering]

SPOM.content: deconstruction takes shape in thinking gift and undeconstructible justice > always risking evil, expropriation and injustice, only way to render justice to the other as other, the irreducible possibility of Un-Fug, excess of disjointure
SPOM.linkedContent: deconstruction takes shape in thinking gift and undeconstructible justice > always risking evil, expropriation and injustice, only way to render justice to the other as other, the irreducible possibility of Un-Fug, excess of disjointure

SPOM.content: “a culture began before culture—and humanity, capitalization also,” a culture destined to survive them: exchange-value is exceeded by the gift, market equivalence arrests the dance (of the commodity) it seemed to initiate
SPOM.linkedContent: “a culture began before culture—and humanity, capitalization also,” a culture destined to survive them: exchange-value is exceeded by the gift, market equivalence arrests the dance (of the commodity) it seemed to initiate

HASD.content: [in Christian apophatics of Dionysus] cause, gift of gift, order and promise are the same
HASD.linkedContent: [in Christian apophatics of Dionysus] cause, gift of gift, order and promise are the same

HERP.content: “philia ist das Gönne der Gunst,” philia is the other’s proper, gift to the other of what is to the other its own proper
HERP.linkedContent: “philia ist das Gönne der Gunst,” philia is the other’s proper, gift to the other of what is to the other its own proper

HERP.content: Heidegger, translating justice (dikē) as Fuge (joint, accord, coupling), wonders how adikia can give justice > the gift of what we don’t have as only gift possible
HERP.linkedContent: Heidegger, translating justice (dikē) as Fuge (joint, accord, coupling), wonders how adikia can give justice > the gift of what we don’t have as only gift possible

POOF.content: Derrida reads Nietzsche [re: GS 61] as advocating acceptance of gift & dependency,  elevating logic of gift above self-sufficiency of a subject [Greek philosopher who refuses King’s donation], a logic that reorients friendship, calling friendship back to irreducibility of other—but perhaps this installs an irresponsible freedom, madness (friend–enemy), the worst?
POOF.linkedContent: Derrida reads Nietzsche [re: GS 61] as advocating acceptance of gift & dependency, elevating logic of gift above self-sufficiency of a subject [Greek philosopher who refuses King’s donation], a logic that reorients friendship, calling friendship back to irreducibility of other—but perhaps this installs an irresponsible freedom, madness (friend–enemy), the worst?

POOF.content: temptation to match Nietzsche’s gesture, call he seems to be making for another justice, one that breaks w/ equivalence of right & vengeance: what’re political consequences for democracy?
POOF.linkedContent: temptation to match Nietzsche’s gesture, call he seems to be making for another justice, one that breaks w/ equivalence of right & vengeance: what’re political consequences for democracy?

POOF.content: a passive decision, responsibility outside of knowledge, outside of subjective decisionism, occurs from the heartbeat of the other (blood arriving), which makes an exception for/of me > opens autonomy on to itself, matches decision to the gift, figure of the heartbeat: [passive decision doesn’t contradict sovereign decision, sovereign becomes guest, other?] [Derrida beyond Levinas]
POOF.linkedContent: a passive decision, responsibility outside of knowledge, outside of subjective decisionism, occurs from the heartbeat of the other (blood arriving), which makes an exception for/of me > opens autonomy on to itself, matches decision to the gift, figure of the heartbeat: [passive decision doesn’t contradict sovereign decision, sovereign becomes guest, other?] [Derrida beyond Levinas]

POOF.content: Augustine’s abyssal calculation, after death of his friend [Confessions IV], his close reading of Aristotle’s friends are ‘one soul in bodies twain’: survivre, ou non, au nom de l’autre? survive for yourself or person you’re mourning? question of gift, donner au nom de l’autre, a narcissism that only occurs in name of other
POOF.linkedContent: Augustine’s abyssal calculation, after death of his friend [Confessions IV], his close reading of Aristotle’s friends are ‘one soul in bodies twain’: survivre, ou non, au nom de l’autre? survive for yourself or person you’re mourning? question of gift, donner au nom de l’autre, a narcissism that only occurs in name of other

POOF.content: via Heidegger, philía as opening, accord, in essential relation w/ phúsis as covering up, dissimulation of self > phúsis qua philía: l’une, comme l’autre, garde ce rapport à la fois généreux et jaloux à elle-même—elle aime à se cacher, krúptesthai phileîn > le retrait de la pudeur [decency] donne ici le mouvement même: gives the gift (donne le don), accords phúsis and philía
POOF.linkedContent: via Heidegger, philía as opening, accord, in essential relation w/ phúsis as covering up, dissimulation of self > phúsis qua philía: l’une, comme l’autre, garde ce rapport à la fois généreux et jaloux à elle-même—elle aime à se cacher, krúptesthai phileîn > le retrait de la pudeur [decency] donne ici le mouvement même: gives the gift (donne le don), accords phúsis and philía

POOF.content: the gift is that which gives friendship in Nietzsche > and yet, friendship still means freedom, equality, fraternity in Nietzsche
POOF.linkedContent: the gift is that which gives friendship in Nietzsche > and yet, friendship still means freedom, equality, fraternity in Nietzsche

POOF.content: quoting Matthew, Derrida asks whether there isn't still profit of a sublime economy, economy beyond economy, in Nietzsche? or does the absolute gift (advising against love of one’s neighbor) break the ruse of this sublime economy? like Kant, isn’t there still best exchange rate for virtue?
POOF.linkedContent: quoting Matthew, Derrida asks whether there isn't still profit of a sublime economy, economy beyond economy, in Nietzsche? or does the absolute gift (advising against love of one’s neighbor) break the ruse of this sublime economy? like Kant, isn’t there still best exchange rate for virtue?

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s gift must also belong to a finite world > how to think dissymmetry of gift w/out exchange, infinite disproportion, from vantage point of terrestrial finitude? under its horizon w/out horizon [see p. 263] > infinitization itself is suspected of being an economic ruse, perverse seduction, stratagem, of loving one’s neighbor
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s gift must also belong to a finite world > how to think dissymmetry of gift w/out exchange, infinite disproportion, from vantage point of terrestrial finitude? under its horizon w/out horizon [see p. 263] > infinitization itself is suspected of being an economic ruse, perverse seduction, stratagem, of loving one’s neighbor

POOF.content: Nietzsche: you must understand how to be a sponge if you want to be loved by overflowing hearts > Nietzsche: in your friend you should love the Superman as your principle
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche: you must understand how to be a sponge if you want to be loved by overflowing hearts > Nietzsche: in your friend you should love the Superman as your principle

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s friend of most distant belongs to finite earth (not world of Christian hinterworld) > friend’s finitude infinitizes the gift he gives [infinite differance is finite] : a friend who doesn’t give you the world (a finite one), gives you nothing [this is neither Greek nor Christian]
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s friend of most distant belongs to finite earth (not world of Christian hinterworld) > friend’s finitude infinitizes the gift he gives [infinite differance is finite] : a friend who doesn’t give you the world (a finite one), gives you nothing [this is neither Greek nor Christian]

POOF.content: Blanchot no longer has affinity w/ one Nietzsche (there is always plus d’un): friendship is not a gift or promise, it’s the outside drawing near in its separateness/inaccessibility—pure desire is the call to bridge (à franchir) the distance, to die in common through separation
POOF.linkedContent: Blanchot no longer has affinity w/ one Nietzsche (there is always plus d’un): friendship is not a gift or promise, it’s the outside drawing near in its separateness/inaccessibility—pure desire is the call to bridge (à franchir) the distance, to die in common through separation

POOF.content: gift should exclude generosity, too natural

MPM.content: there is no gift except on aporetic condition of no present, gift is only a promise, promised memory
MPM.linkedContent: there is no gift except on aporetic condition of no present, gift is only a promise, promised memory

MPM.content: “always necessary to excuse oneself for giving,” given its risk of its being in annulled in thanks, given that it never arrives in present
MPM.linkedContent: “always necessary to excuse oneself for giving,” given its risk of its being in annulled in thanks, given that it never arrives in present

VM.content: for Levinas, origin of concept must be the gift of the world to the other as tout autre, not the thought of Being
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, origin of concept must be the gift of the world to the other as tout autre, not the thought of Being

PAS.content: pas de don has to recall itself in order to come about: knot (pas) of truth, truth of knot (pas) > begins to be ensnared in trap of law
PAS.linkedContent: pas de don has to recall itself in order to come about: knot (pas) of truth, truth of knot (pas) > begins to be ensnared in trap of law

PAS.content: gift hands over to anonymity, forgetfulness of name, au pas de nom, au pas du nom
PAS.linkedContent: gift hands over to anonymity, forgetfulness of name, au pas de nom, au pas du nom

PAS.content: the gift w/out knowing (sans le savoir), the sole possible, the impossible
PAS.linkedContent: the gift w/out knowing (sans le savoir), the sole possible, the impossible

PAS.content: [on not citing his sources] the worst méconaissance of Blanchot’s text, hand over incommensurable in it to the market, the hierarchy, the dominant effects tied to name & law, but [other voice] there’s always benefits of mastery for sovereign renunciation, it’s gonna happen, il faut en rendre compte, the gift itself never forgets itself, nor the forgetting
PAS.linkedContent: [on not citing his sources] the worst méconaissance of Blanchot’s text, hand over incommensurable in it to the market, the hierarchy, the dominant effects tied to name & law, but [other voice] there’s always benefits of mastery for sovereign renunciation, it’s gonna happen, il faut en rendre compte, the gift itself never forgets itself, nor the forgetting

PAS.content: forgetting must guard itself (se guarder) to preserve the gift, so the gift can give, the bank (berge) and contamination poison the gift
PAS.linkedContent: forgetting must guard itself (se guarder) to preserve the gift, so the gift can give, the bank (berge) and contamination poison the gift

PAS.content: must be able to reject the gift, vomir ce qui t’appelle à dire viens, forget in order to reject the poison, to not guard the gift
PAS.linkedContent: must be able to reject the gift, vomir ce qui t’appelle à dire viens, forget in order to reject the poison, to not guard the gift

S.content: in Der Ister, Hölderlin calls to the fire, Jetzt komme, Feuer!, fire as what comes, call for to-come > acc. Heidegger, Hölderlin, the Beseeler, has been struck by God of light, gift of spirit as incineration, cremation, almost becoming ash [MOP & annihilation of trace]
S.linkedContent: in Der Ister, Hölderlin calls to the fire, Jetzt komme, Feuer!, fire as what comes, call for to-come > acc. Heidegger, Hölderlin, the Beseeler, has been struck by God of light, gift of spirit as incineration, cremation, almost becoming ash [MOP & annihilation of trace]

TC.content: [see NIETZSCHE & HEGEL on pure expenditure, death, repetition of affirmation, maintaining presence, consume pure difference w/ pleasure]
TC.linkedContent: [see NIETZSCHE & HEGEL on pure expenditure, death, repetition of affirmation, maintaining presence, consume pure difference w/ pleasure]

SH.content: gift of the poem, and of the date: no dialectic > condition [of poem] made up of distress, hope, shi[f]t of tones, “Weschsel der Töne” [Hölderlin]
SH.linkedContent: gift of the poem, and of the date: no dialectic > condition [of poem] made up of distress, hope, shi[f]t of tones, “Weschsel der Töne” [Hölderlin]

FWT.content: leave life in life & make it live again, “let live,” laisser, most beautiful, hazardous thing, like giving up, giving over the gift, forgiveness > deconstruction never w/out this love, pays homage to those it takes on, s’en prendre
FWT.linkedContent: leave life in life & make it live again, “let live,” laisser, most beautiful, hazardous thing, like giving up, giving over the gift, forgiveness > deconstruction never w/out this love, pays homage to those it takes on, s’en prendre

ROP.content: what rejects analysis: affirmation of gift as trace

OTO.content: autobiographical récit, tells himself his life, affirms EROS, gratitude for gift (gift: establishment of my own credit w/ this name): EROS signs or seals > before such signature, my life may be mere prejudice (reaffirmation of the hymen, alliance or wedding ring, eternal return, “yes, yes” to shadowless gift of high noon)
OTO.linkedContent: autobiographical récit, tells himself his life, affirms EROS, gratitude for gift (gift: establishment of my own credit w/ this name): EROS signs or seals > before such signature, my life may be mere prejudice (reaffirmation of the hymen, alliance or wedding ring, eternal return, “yes, yes” to shadowless gift of high noon)

SW.content: c’est un don qu’ils ordonnent [re: regulations of tallith]
SW.linkedContent: c’est un don qu’ils ordonnent [re: regulations of tallith]

TB.content: God: name of the origin of tongues (lips, langues), name of father > God also sows confusion among his sons, poisons his gift (Gift-gift)
TB.linkedContent: God: name of the origin of tongues (lips, langues), name of father > God also sows confusion among his sons, poisons his gift (Gift-gift)

Gii.content: hand or gift > is this the site of sexual desire (Geschlecht in sexual difference)?
Gii.linkedContent: hand or gift > is this the site of sexual desire (Geschlecht in sexual difference)?

Gii.content: Heidegger’s hand: holds, carries, welcomes, signs—presumably because man is a sign > (does Phenomenology of Spirit say anything different?)
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger’s hand: holds, carries, welcomes, signs—presumably because man is a sign > (does Phenomenology of Spirit say anything different?)

Gii.content: in Benveniste, “Exchange & Gift,” which Derrida referenced in GT, nothing less assured than distinction btwn giving/taking: bad & good gift (gift/Gift or pharmakon)
Gii.linkedContent: in Benveniste, “Exchange & Gift,” which Derrida referenced in GT, nothing less assured than distinction btwn giving/taking: bad & good gift (gift/Gift or pharmakon)

REST.content: gift, abyss, offering, there is abyss > essence of Van Gogh’s painting, via Heidegger’s Origin, opens onto an abyss (not attributive certainty, secure ground of [Cartesian-Hegelian] subjectivity)
REST.linkedContent: gift, abyss, offering, there is abyss > essence of Van Gogh’s painting, via Heidegger’s Origin, opens onto an abyss (not attributive certainty, secure ground of [Cartesian-Hegelian] subjectivity)

REST.content: Origin an essay on the gift (Schenkung), one of 3 senses in which truth is said to come to its installation, institution, investiture (Stiftung), there’s also the “founding (Gründen)” > this truth which is also nontruth also opens onto the “abyss”
REST.linkedContent: Origin an essay on the gift (Schenkung), one of 3 senses in which truth is said to come to its installation, institution, investiture (Stiftung), there’s also the “founding (Gründen)” > this truth which is also nontruth also opens onto the “abyss”

REST.content: Verlässlichkeit > pre-originary gift (don) or abandon [Derrida scolds his interlocutor (“don’t play utilities”) for hurrying to recognizes schemas: “to/from THE-MOTHER” for reliability]
REST.linkedContent: Verlässlichkeit > pre-originary gift (don) or abandon [Derrida scolds his interlocutor (“don’t play utilities”) for hurrying to recognizes schemas: “to/from THE-MOTHER” for reliability]

DST.content: Lacoue-Labarthe’s hyperbologic programs inevitable “logic” of mimesis, converts gift of everything to gift of nothing, to gift of thing itself
DST.linkedContent: Lacoue-Labarthe’s hyperbologic programs inevitable “logic” of mimesis, converts gift of everything to gift of nothing, to gift of thing itself

DST.content: play of de- might belong to hyperbologic, belongs to and escapes its own series: “gift of mimesis,” “gift of impropriety,” not negative (dialecticizable)
DST.linkedContent: play of de- might belong to hyperbologic, belongs to and escapes its own series: “gift of mimesis,” “gift of impropriety,” not negative (dialecticizable)

DST.content: organizes/disorganizes what it appears to determine
DST.linkedContent: organizes/disorganizes what it appears to determine

IW.content: [vis-à-vis Rosenzweig, Cohen] system cannot be given, forbids or reappropriates the gift in advance (in a circular manner) > most generous gift: give to think beyond system
IW.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Rosenzweig, Cohen] system cannot be given, forbids or reappropriates the gift in advance (in a circular manner) > most generous gift: give to think beyond system

HST.content: forgiveness granted to other—supreme gift of hospitality > host too must ask forgiveness, welcoming must be infinite, one can never give enough to surprise of visitor, messianic surprise: host, always lacking, at fault, unprepared
HST.linkedContent: forgiveness granted to other—supreme gift of hospitality > host too must ask forgiveness, welcoming must be infinite, one can never give enough to surprise of visitor, messianic surprise: host, always lacking, at fault, unprepared

HST.content: unsolvable, vertiginous depth of sans-fond, irresistible whirlpool that carries forgiveness, gift, re-giving, re-dealing of forgiveness, to the abyss of the impossible
HST.linkedContent: unsolvable, vertiginous depth of sans-fond, irresistible whirlpool that carries forgiveness, gift, re-giving, re-dealing of forgiveness, to the abyss of the impossible

HST.content: forgiveness, hospitality, gift affix condition of impossibility to the other: gift as most unforgivable
HST.linkedContent: forgiveness, hospitality, gift affix condition of impossibility to the other: gift as most unforgivable

HST.content: that one can neither say nor even think “I invite you,” “I forgive you,” w/out destroying gift in commerce, calls for an inaudibility that would prevent living beings from forgiving each other > forgive before the death of the other & before my death
HST.linkedContent: that one can neither say nor even think “I invite you,” “I forgive you,” w/out destroying gift in commerce, calls for an inaudibility that would prevent living beings from forgiving each other > forgive before the death of the other & before my death

HST.content: “in/at the place of (à la place de, au lieu de, en lieu et place de),” “for (pour)” indicating substitution & gift: entering economy of gift/sacrifice to exceed it > [lieu-tenants]
HST.linkedContent: “in/at the place of (à la place de, au lieu de, en lieu et place de),” “for (pour)” indicating substitution & gift: entering economy of gift/sacrifice to exceed it > [lieu-tenants]

C.content: there is the gift (es gibt) and there is what I couldn’t give: I want to keep it better than ever
C.linkedContent: there is the gift (es gibt) and there is what I couldn’t give: I want to keep it better than ever

TN.content: what embarrasses Derrida in word “generosity,” like “fraternity”: always refers to filiation, principle of “birth,” concerns “virility,” doesn’t include woman > if generosity is a capacity/force/power given at birth, can one still give?
TN.linkedContent: what embarrasses Derrida in word “generosity,” like “fraternity”: always refers to filiation, principle of “birth,” concerns “virility,” doesn’t include woman > if generosity is a capacity/force/power given at birth, can one still give?

TN.content: for Nancy, offering in the gift is the “withdrawal of the gift,” of its being-present
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, offering in the gift is the “withdrawal of the gift,” of its being-present

TN.content: heart: condition of desire, the effraction of the other, of what can’t return to self
TN.linkedContent: heart: condition of desire, the effraction of the other, of what can’t return to self

TN.content: diastole, absolute generosity, generosity more generous than generosity itself, orients us toward epekeina tēs ousisas, Plotinus’ One
TN.linkedContent: diastole, absolute generosity, generosity more generous than generosity itself, orients us toward epekeina tēs ousisas, Plotinus’ One

TN.content: limit, border (bord), which are nothing, make any gift (don) possible
TN.linkedContent: limit, border (bord), which are nothing, make any gift (don) possible

TN.content: [re: Nancy’s distinction btwn gift & offering] how can you eschew economics w/ the value of “keeping (garde)”? [Nancy describes how the surprise of the gift is kept]
TN.linkedContent: [re: Nancy’s distinction btwn gift & offering] how can you eschew economics w/ the value of “keeping (garde)”? [Nancy describes how the surprise of the gift is kept]

ATM.content: absolute dissymmetry of the gift, wanting to give by receiving, wanting to avoid commerce, mastery (feeling trapped), economic reappropriating: sensitive to the excess that overflows language > nothing is more difficult than to except a gift
ATM.linkedContent: absolute dissymmetry of the gift, wanting to give by receiving, wanting to avoid commerce, mastery (feeling trapped), economic reappropriating: sensitive to the excess that overflows language > nothing is more difficult than to except a gift

ATM.content: for Levinas, sincerity or rectitude: the right of the gift (not derived from a jurisdiction transcendent to the gift itself), to go right to the unique, what his name will have uniquely named
ATM.linkedContent: for Levinas, sincerity or rectitude: the right of the gift (not derived from a jurisdiction transcendent to the gift itself), to go right to the unique, what his name will have uniquely named

ATM.content: gift of other, debt w/out contract, demands: at the same time, indefinitely equivalent substitution (anonymity) and singularity (rather, absolute uniqueness of proper name)
ATM.linkedContent: gift of other, debt w/out contract, demands: at the same time, indefinitely equivalent substitution (anonymity) and singularity (rather, absolute uniqueness of proper name)

ATM.content: the grammatical utterance [“here I am”?] is there, but put out of joint (disloqué), making room (that is not a home) for an agrammaticality of the gift assigned from the other (depuis l’autre)
ATM.linkedContent: the grammatical utterance [“here I am”?] is there, but put out of joint (disloqué), making room (that is not a home) for an agrammaticality of the gift assigned from the other (depuis l’autre)

ATM.content: incorporating what it can’t assimilate, quoting the uncitable consists in accusing language [appearing as witness & accused], (sur)rendered (offerre) to a gift, as a gift which language can’t open up to on its own
ATM.linkedContent: incorporating what it can’t assimilate, quoting the uncitable consists in accusing language [appearing as witness & accused], (sur)rendered (offerre) to a gift, as a gift which language can’t open up to on its own

ATM.content: for Levinas, logos is not secondary/instrumental, it remains indispensable as fold (pli) that bends (se plie) to the gift, as the tongue (langue) of my mouth when I tear bread from it to give it to the other > it is also my body
ATM.linkedContent: for Levinas, logos is not secondary/instrumental, it remains indispensable as fold (pli) that bends (se plie) to the gift, as the tongue (langue) of my mouth when I tear bread from it to give it to the other > it is also my body

ATM.content: inconsolable slowness of gift, as if necessary to delay the endless falling due (échéance) of repetition
ATM.linkedContent: inconsolable slowness of gift, as if necessary to delay the endless falling due (échéance) of repetition

E.content: the fold of mimesis at origin of pure productivity: a gift for itself (pour soi) of God who makes a present of himself to himself
E.linkedContent: the fold of mimesis at origin of pure productivity: a gift for itself (pour soi) of God who makes a present of himself to himself

AD.content: the instantaneous meantime of the decision (l’entretemps instantané de la décision), contretemps, hiatus, or non-response, discontinues speech and is gift of speech
AD.linkedContent: the instantaneous meantime of the decision (l’entretemps instantané de la décision), contretemps, hiatus, or non-response, discontinues speech and is gift of speech

AD.content: w/out silence, w/out non-response: simply unfold (dérouler) knowledge in a program > nothing would make us more irresponsible, nothing more totalitarian
AD.linkedContent: w/out silence, w/out non-response: simply unfold (dérouler) knowledge in a program > nothing would make us more irresponsible, nothing more totalitarian

CIN.content: holocaust as gift before every determinable being [see CIN in FIRE]
CIN.linkedContent: holocaust as gift before every determinable being [see CIN in FIRE]

CIN.content: cinder comes in place of the gift
CIN.linkedContent: cinder comes in place of the gift

CIN.content: Derrida’s not accumulating surplus value, speculating on some cinder capital, but making a withdrawal (retrait), to try his luck on a gift w/out the least memory of itself, un retrait (retreat, retracing) w/ no relation to what he just did, what he’s about to tell you
CIN.linkedContent: Derrida’s not accumulating surplus value, speculating on some cinder capital, but making a withdrawal (retrait), to try his luck on a gift w/out the least memory of itself, un retrait (retreat, retracing) w/ no relation to what he just did, what he’s about to tell you

ATAP.content: grace when writing of other absolves you from double bind, gift unbinds itself from double bind > grace can never be proven, improbable: belief itself
ATAP.linkedContent: grace when writing of other absolves you from double bind, gift unbinds itself from double bind > grace can never be proven, improbable: belief itself

EU.content: thought of sendoff (envoi), dispensation or gift of being: one of most powerful/singular attempts to think history/structure of onto-theology: Shickung, Schicksal, Gabe, “es gibt Sein,” “es gibt Zeit” do not seem to belong w/in onto-theological philosophemes
EU.linkedContent: thought of sendoff (envoi), dispensation or gift of being: one of most powerful/singular attempts to think history/structure of onto-theology: Shickung, Schicksal, Gabe, “es gibt Sein,” “es gibt Zeit” do not seem to belong w/in onto-theological philosophemes

EU.content: [CIPH] “basic,” “fundamental” research should cease being ashamed of itself [due to pressure from sciences, especially social sciences], research the “basic” around series gift/destination w/out returning to hegemonic structure > a “scheme” that never becomes “program” or obligatory “theme”
EU.linkedContent: [CIPH] “basic,” “fundamental” research should cease being ashamed of itself [due to pressure from sciences, especially social sciences], research the “basic” around series gift/destination w/out returning to hegemonic structure > a “scheme” that never becomes “program” or obligatory “theme”

SPEC.content: Derrida corrupts (détourne) “properly Freudian” usage of speculation [i.e. a mode proper mode of research]: as production of surplus value, overflows, the given of the gift, oblique object of Freud’s discourse > Freud’s bias of procedure interests Derrida, the scene of what makes Freud write: faire faire, laisser faire, faire écrire, laisser écrire: the syntax of these operations not given [in Freud]
SPEC.linkedContent: Derrida corrupts (détourne) “properly Freudian” usage of speculation [i.e. a mode proper mode of research]: as production of surplus value, overflows, the given of the gift, oblique object of Freud’s discourse > Freud’s bias of procedure interests Derrida, the scene of what makes Freud write: faire faire, laisser faire, faire écrire, laisser écrire: the syntax of these operations not given [in Freud]

FV.content: [profiting from remnant] by means of a remnant of paternal inheritance, one the debtors left out of account, Dupin draws revenue, surplus-value of a capital that works by itself, calculating (rigorous economy) > Dupin can pay for a sole luxury [Dupin’s desire to read]: cuts across restricted economy like gift w/out return
FV.linkedContent: [profiting from remnant] by means of a remnant of paternal inheritance, one the debtors left out of account, Dupin draws revenue, surplus-value of a capital that works by itself, calculating (rigorous economy) > Dupin can pay for a sole luxury [Dupin’s desire to read]: cuts across restricted economy like gift w/out return

WBH.content: if gift has assignable destination, is an exchange, it’s not a gift, if there is from man to woman (or woman to man) an assignable destination (re: object, discourse, jouissance, desire, subject), no longer a gift > gift must be absolutely unconscious & random to be given a chance
WBH.linkedContent: if gift has assignable destination, is an exchange, it’s not a gift, if there is from man to woman (or woman to man) an assignable destination (re: object, discourse, jouissance, desire, subject), no longer a gift > gift must be absolutely unconscious & random to be given a chance

WBH.content: opposition is 2, is man/woman, sexual difference can be an indefinite # of sexes > w/ the 2, the classical sense of sexual difference, gift is impossible, all you can call “gift” (love, jouissance) is forbidden by dual opposition
WBH.linkedContent: opposition is 2, is man/woman, sexual difference can be an indefinite # of sexes > w/ the 2, the classical sense of sexual difference, gift is impossible, all you can call “gift” (love, jouissance) is forbidden by dual opposition

WBH.content: gift possible not outside of sexuality but outside frame familiar to us > a sexuality completely out of the frame
WBH.linkedContent: gift possible not outside of sexuality but outside frame familiar to us > a sexuality completely out of the frame

WBH.content: gift beyond sexual duality > Heidegger’s attempt to neutralize sexual opposition and not sexual difference, liberating field of sexuality for very different sexuality, more multiple: no more sexes, one sex for each time, each gift, a sexual difference for each gift
WBH.linkedContent: gift beyond sexual duality > Heidegger’s attempt to neutralize sexual opposition and not sexual difference, liberating field of sexuality for very different sexuality, more multiple: no more sexes, one sex for each time, each gift, a sexual difference for each gift

WBH.content: gift determines, produces identity of giver & receiver, gives itself the right to determine, always a strike of force, irruption
WBH.linkedContent: gift determines, produces identity of giver & receiver, gives itself the right to determine, always a strike of force, irruption

WBH.content: receiver as determining factor of gift, one who responds, performativity of text produces receiver w/out pre-existing [him/her/it]
WBH.linkedContent: receiver as determining factor of gift, one who responds, performativity of text produces receiver w/out pre-existing [him/her/it]

WBH.content: it is by the gift that Law is produced, the signature engenders sender, receiver, signer
WBH.linkedContent: it is by the gift that Law is produced, the signature engenders sender, receiver, signer

WBH.content: gift not even subversive, is something else > subversion is a program, programmed destruction of certain conditions (relies on given conditions)
WBH.linkedContent: gift not even subversive, is something else > subversion is a program, programmed destruction of certain conditions (relies on given conditions)

WBH.content: to receive a gift, in Nietzschean sense, is to say, “I want to begin again,” not a reproduction: “yes” of gift must be repeatable from the start
WBH.linkedContent: to receive a gift, in Nietzschean sense, is to say, “I want to begin again,” not a reproduction: “yes” of gift must be repeatable from the start

CHOR.content: [cf. WBH p. 198] could femininity, however irreducible it may be, remain derived from or subordinated to question of destination or thought of gift?
CHOR.linkedContent: [cf. WBH p. 198] could femininity, however irreducible it may be, remain derived from or subordinated to question of destination or thought of gift?
